WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Static members are part of the constructor function of a class, thus not part of the structure of the type. Since an interface only describes the structure of a type, it doesn't have a constructor function, thus static members don't make sense.

You can start a discussion on the Discussion board if you have more questions.

Thanks
WorkItem.Description: Why it is not possible to have static methods into interfaces? I should be possible to do such things, it's kinda basic.

Comments.Message:
I don't agree with that.
Does PHP/C# have Static method/attributes in interface? I think so.

It's possible in Ruby for instance.
Of course, the static methods must be defined in the interface.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21817/why-cant-i-declare-static-methods-in-an-interface
